Authors:
Diogo Henrique Costa-Rezende, Aristóteles Góes-Neto,
Ricardo Drechsler-Santos, Morag Glen, Genevieve Gates, Barbara M Bonzi,
Orlando F. Popoff, Esteban M. Crespo, Gerardo Lucio Robledo
Title: Taxonomy and phylogeny of Ganodermatoid polypores
Abstract:
Polypores with complex basidiospore morphology are usually
classified in the Ganodermataceae, and are mainly characterized by
having double-walled basidiospores with a coloured endosporium
ornamented with columns or ridges, and a hyaline smooth exosporium.
Although as a group it presents well-delimited morphological features,
recent phylogenetic studies raised divergent opinions about the
monophyly of the group. In order to clarify some of the uncertainties of
generic delimitation and classification of the group and test its
monophyly, morphological and molecular phylogenetic analyses based on
ITS-5.8S, LSU, TEF-1α were carried out. The main outcomes of the study
are: (i) although monophyletic the family should be treated as a synonym
of Polyporaceae; (ii) Amaurodermellus is proposed to accommodate a
Neotropical species with ovoid spores previously classified in
Amauroderma (A.ovisporum); (iii) Leucoganoderma is proposed to
accommodate the species with pale context and truncate basidiospores
with endosporic ornamentation as ridges (Ganoderma coffeatum and G.
flaviporum). Moreover, comments on other noteworthy species are also
presented.
